intro: Evea brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian evergreen, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense tropical forests. The botanical features of Evea brasiliensis make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
